meanings.definition: A hollow part or piece for receiving and holding something
meanings.sent1: She placed the marble in the socket of the game board.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used a socket to tighten the bolt securely.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to hide its acorn in the socket of the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The key fit perfectly into the socket of the lock, turning smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The socket in the wall was the perfect place to charge her phone.

meanings.definition: A receptacle into which an electric plug can be inserted
meanings.sent1: He plugged the lamp into the socket on the wall.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to unplug the device from the socket before cleaning it.
meanings.sent3: The overloaded power strip caused the socket to spark and sizzle.
meanings.sent4: She felt a shock when she accidentally touched the metal part of the socket.
meanings.sent5: The socket on the power bar had enough space for all the plugs.

meanings.definition: A joint or connecting point where two parts come together
meanings.sent1: The socket where the pipes connected started leaking water.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter ensured a strong joint by using a socket for the wood pieces.
meanings.sent3: The friendship between the two was like a socket, always bringing them together.
meanings.sent4: The socket between the train cars allowed passengers to move freely.
meanings.sent5: The socket between the puzzle pieces was the key to completing the picture.
